title: Foundational Bioinformatics Education for Medicine: Short-Intensive Course Using Blended Instructional Design

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level knowledge and practical experience in the relevant field
context.additional_context: A course designed for clinical bioinformatics tool utilization. Applies blended instructional methods combining Gagné's 9 Events and Peyton's 4-Step Approach

learning_goals: Learners can explain how to utilize bioinformatics foundational tools (e.g., BLAST, NCBI databases) for clinical data analysis
Learners can interpret genomic data and logically connect its clinical relevance
Learners complete microlearning modules simulating bioinformatics workflows in mobile environments with an 80%+ completion rate

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
